channel.title: Annoying issue with error handler (Ironic, I know)

item.title: Annoying issue with error handler (Ironic, I know)
item.dc:creator: @zeifyl zeifyl
item.description:
@zeifyl wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:25, topic:546688”]It could be that the process he’s carrying out is being iterated repetitively, so it doesn’t update until it’s all done (or not at all, if the window is closed after the last iteration).

sauce: happens in c#[/quote]
It does the calculations instantly when the input is correct, and doesn’t close the window, so I highly doubt that is the issue.

Read full topic

item.title: Annoying issue with error handler (Ironic, I know)
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

public void combatFormula(JLabel result, JTextField skill1, JTextField skill2, JTextField equipmentBonus) { try { String i, j, k; i = skill1.getText(); j = skill2.getText(); k = equipmentBonus.getText(); if (isValidInput(i) && isValidInput(j) && isValidInput(k)) { result.setText("" + (int) getCombatUtil(Integer.parseInt(i), Integer.parseInt(j), Integer.parseInt(k))); } } catch (NumberFormatException e) { e.printStackTrace(); result.setText("Invalid!"); } } 

   public boolean isValidInput(String s) {
      return s.matches("[0-9]+");
}

Read full topic

item.title: Annoying issue with error handler (Ironic, I know)
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

Use the NumberFormatException

public void combatFormula(JLabel result, JTextField skill1, JTextField skill2, JTextField equipmentBonus) { try { int i, j, k; i = Integer.parseInt(skill1.getText()); j = Integer.parseInt(skill2.getText()); k = Integer.parseInt(equipmentBonus.getText()); result.setText("" + (int) getCombatUtil(i, j, k)); } catch (NumberFormatException e) { e.printStackTrace(); result.setText("Invalid!"); } }

Read full topic
item.source: Annoying issue with error handler (Ironic, I know)

item.title: Annoying issue with error handler (Ironic, I know)
item.dc:creator: @zeifyl zeifyl
item.description:
@zeifyl wrote:

The different variables are used in a GUI, and the text from some of the textbars in the GUI are getting converted to numbers, calculated with that code, and thrown out again as a number in a text label on another part of the GUI.
It should throw the exception when I try to use letters, symbols, or nothing, instead of numbers where the numbers are written.

combatFormula(meleeMaxHitLabel, strengthValueTextField, strengthValueTextField, strBonusValueTextField); is one of the lines it is used in.
meleeMaxHitLabel is the text label which outputs the Maximum Melee hit.
strengthValueTextField is used twice as skill1 and skill2, calculating the strength level into the entire thing. For some reason it doesn’t throw the exception when there is an error in those.
strBonusValueTextField is the Strength Bonus. That one can throw the exception perfectly fine.

Read full topic
item.source: Annoying issue with error handler (Ironic, I know)

item.title: Annoying issue with error handler (Ironic, I know)
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

Try to use if - else statements. And I think the issue is that you aren’t really TRYING to do anything there that would throw an exception. All you’re doing is setting variables. Basically, tell me the circumstances under which you would like the “Invalid!” text to be used.

Read full topic
item.source: Annoying issue with error handler (Ironic, I know)
